inclusion.criterion: Diagnosis of asthma as defined by the National Institutes of Health (NIH)
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: A best FEV1 of 40%-85% of the predicted normal value during the screening visit (SV)
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Subjects need to demonstrate a ≥ 15% reversibility of FEV1 within 30 minutes following 4 inhalations of albuterol inhalation aerosol (if required, spacers are permitted for reversibility testing) at the SV.
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: History of life-threatening asthma that is defined for this protocol as an asthma episode that required intubation.
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Culture-documented or suspected bacterial or viral infection of the upper or lower respiratory tract, sinus, or middle ear that is not resolved within 2 weeks prior to the SV.
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Any asthma exacerbation requiring oral corticosteroids within 3 months of the SV. A subject must not have had any hospitalization for asthma within 6 months prior to the SV.
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Taking long-acting β-agonists within 2 weeks of the SV
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: Patient has a history of asthma and uses inhaled corticosteroid (ICS) and fluticasone 500 mcg/salmeterol 50 mcg. He has not had any hospitalization for asthma within the past 6 months.
